result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Scott Mewhorter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian Scott Mewhorter is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian Scott Mewhorter was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office. Fines to be taken out of bond, remainder due to be paid on a monthly payment plan of $25.00 per month beginning on 6/1/2016 and on the first of each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will be warrant.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $200.00 DNA surcharge to the Clerk of Court's Office. Surcharge to be taken out of bond, remainder due to be paid on said monthly payment plan beginning on 6/1/2016. Failure to pay will be warrant. Must stop at jail today.
Must pay a $200.00 Domestic Abuse surcharge to the Clerk of Court's Office. Fines to be taken out of bond, remainder due to be paid on said monthly payment plan beginning on 6/1/2016. Failure to pay will be warrant.
Must complete AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

Absolute Sobriety.
Not to have abusive contact with: Tonya Dudek.
Must complete Domestic Abuse assessment and comply with recommendations.

T.D.

CASES: 15CF424, 15CF372 Defendant Brian Scott Mewhorter in court with attorney Dan Firkus.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   KJB- Clerk. 937am 

15CF372 Ct 2: Plea of NC. CT accepts plea, finds G, enters JOC. All other Cts dismissed. Dismissed 15CF424.

SENTENCING on Ct 2 in 15CF372- w/h sent, prob 2 years- appear today, bank 120 days in jail for use of agent if necessary, no abusive contact w/Ms Dudek, AODA & comply, Dom Abuse assess & comply, AS, $265.60 fine/cost, $200 DNA surcharge & sample- stop at jail today, $200 Dom Abuse surcharge, fines to come out of bond. $25/mo PP beg 6/1/16 and 1st of e/m thereafter. sent credit TBD. 947am adj.
Return of Service re subpoena served on Tonya Dudeck on 3/2/16
Jury trial at 03-16-2016 08:30 am

2 CASES:  15CF424 & 15CF372:  Defendant Brian Scott Mewhorter in court with attorney Dan Firkus.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JP-clerk  11:24 Status - had a plea, but addl charges, DE needs time to consider new plea.  CT sets JT - #4 position.  Bond Continues.  11:26 adj.  Jury trial scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian Scott Mewhorter not in court.   Daniel Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KM-clerk-1:40 p.m.  Cases:  15CF424,15CF372.  Victim Tanya Dudec here requesting lifing no contact.  Ms. Dudec appeared back on 11/4/15 requesting no contact be modified and ultimately was denied, she took appropriate class as did Mr. Mewhorter, Ms. Dudec back looking for reconsideration.  State-objected last time because of charges and has concerns for her safety.  CT-can't allow Terry Mewhorter (Brian's dad) be a intermediator but both Tanya and Brian will not have contact.  CT-modifies on face of bond, to allow Terry Mewhorter to act as a go between to allow exchange of information regarding household bills and issues regarding the children.  CT-goes over no contact once again with Tanya.  CT-modifies on both bonds and provides copy to Ms. Dudec.  Clerk to provide copies to Atty Firkus.  Adjourn 1:49 p.m.
Victim Request to Amend Bond Conditions.  Court Order to Amend Bond and Conditions of Bond - REQUEST DENIED.
re victim to take DVAP

10% CASH COMPONENT BEFORE RELEASED FROM JAIL.  Absolute Sobriety.  No illegal substances.  Must have clean UA before release from jail.  Not to have contact with: Tonya Dudek.  One visit to residence with Law Enforcement to retrieve any personal items.
